explanation: Agent A is correct. The for loop in question (for (; len >= (int)sizeof(int); ptr += sizeof(int), len -= sizeof(int))) uses len as the loop-control expression but the third clause modifies both len and ptr. MISRA C 2023 Rule 14.2 requires the third clause to modify only the loop counter (and there shall be only one loop counter). Modifying ptr in the third clause (an object other than the loop counter) violates that requirement. Note also that the preceding loop (for (; len && ((uintptr_t)ptr % sizeof(int)); ptr++, len--)) similarly modifies two objects in the third clause and also breaches the rule.
